716518f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Castle Garden, later Aquarium on Hudson River shore.
716518f-a.text:
Battery Park: The castle Garden, later the Aquarium, on the Hudson River shore.

Mark Carnivale.
1880.
716518f-a.folder: Battery Park & Castle Garden, later Aquarium on Hudson River shore., Manhattan, NY

716512f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Castle Garden.
716512f-a.text:
Battery Park: A southward view of the western side of same and showing Castle Garden at the waters edge.  Beyond same, in the Upper Bay, is the Statue of Liberty erected on Bedloes Island. Castle Garden, soon to become the Aquarium, is at this date an emigrant-depot.
1889.
Brown Brothers.
716512f-a.folder: Battery Park & Castle Garden., Manhattan, NY

716506f.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716506f.text:
Bureau of Immigration

Battery Park
New York City
1897

716526f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - the Aquarium (Old Castle Garden).
716526f-a.text:
Battery Park. The Aquarium, (Old Castle Garden), N.Y.
Detroit Photographic Co.
Date: 1900.
716526f-a.folder: Battery Park & the Aquarium (Old Castle Garden)., Manhattan, NY

716556f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Broadway (North).
716556f-a.text:
Battery Park: A northward view to Broadway, from the waters edge. To the left is the Washington Building. On the right is the tower atop the Produce Exchange. Note the absence of the U. S. Custom House.
About 1900
Thomas W. Kennedy, photo
Thru Beecher Ogden
Museum Photographers Assn.

716541f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716541f-a.text:
Battery Park: The monument erected by the city in 1818 to mark the S.W. bastion of Fort George. It disappeared in some mysterious manner, probably during the filling in of the Battery in 1851. It was unearthed during the excavations for the subway, and was replaced near the sidewalk in the grounds of the park in 1907. [It is now in the N.Y.H. Society. Aug, 1942.  E.V.]
Sept. 11, 1904.
Gift of W. Jerone Daly
Sec't., Board of Transportation City of New York
William H. Parsons Collection

716521f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium.
716521f-a.text:
Battery Park: The western half of same, viewed southward from the Whitehall Building and showing the Aquarium at the confluence of the North River (right) and the Upper Bay.  In the left background appears Governors Island with its rotund "Castle William."
September 20, 1906.
Brown Brothers.

716522f.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium.
716522f.text:
Battery Park: The Aquarium (formerly Castle Garden) nestling at the foot of the North (Hudson) River. Across the latter appears the New Jersey shoreline.
About 1910.
Neg 97

716552f.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - [Shore and skyline.]
716552f.text:
March 14,1914 From the Review of Reviews. Photo by American Press Assn.
Battery Park
716552f.folder: Battery Park & [Shore and skyline.], Manhattan, NY

716557f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street (Northeast).
716557f-a.text:
Battery Park: A northeastward view towards State Street (elevated line thereon) and showing under construction, at the S.E. corner of that
and Bridge Street, the 12-story Battery Park Building.
About 1915.
Ewing Galloway
716557f-a.folder: Battery Park & State Street (Northeast)., Manhattan, NY

710050f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
710050f-a.text:
Battery Park: A northward view from the Sea Wall showing citizens enjoying a respite from the summmer heat. Undergoing reconstruction is the Washington Bldg. (No. 1 Broadway). Beyond same is the Woolworth Bldg. silhouette with the Equitable roof and the Bankers Trust pyramid opposite. The latter is overshadowing the Standard Oil Buildings and the U.S. Custom House.
About 1915
Ewing Galloway

716559f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park (North).
716559f-b.text:
Battery Park: A set of three views of the high wind and tide breaking at this point. No. 1 is northward across same to show buildings on Battery Place; No. 2 being at the rear of the Aquarium, and No. 3, the Basin to
the west of the latter point.
October 25, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.

716559f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park (North).
716559f-a.text:
Battery Park: A set of three views of the high wind and tide breaking at this point. No. 1 is northward across same to show buildings on Battery Place; No. 2 being at the rear of the Aquarium, and No. 3, the Basin to
the west of the latter point.
October 25, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.

716559f-c.title: Manhattan: Battery Park (North).
716559f-c.text:
Battery Park: A set of three views of the high wind and tide breaking at this point. No. 1 is northward across same to show buildings on Battery Place; No. 2 being at the rear of the Aquarium, and No. 3, the Basin to
the west of the latter point.
October 25, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.

716537f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716537f-a.text:
Battery Park: A set of three views showing the high wind and tide breaking at this point. No. 1 is a northward view across same to show the building outline on the northern boundary; No. 2 and 3 being eastward to the Ellis Island Ferry and United States Barge Office.
October 25, 1926.

P.L. Sperr.

716537f-c.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716537f-c.text:
Battery Park: A set of three views showing the high wind and tide breaking at this point. No. 1 is a northward view across same to show the building outline on the northern boundary; No. 2 and 3 being eastward to the Ellis Island Ferry and United States Barge Office.
October 25, 1926.

P.L. Sperr.

716537f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716537f-b.text:
Battery Park: A set of three views showing the high wind and tide breaking at this point. No. 1 is a northward view across same to show the building outline on the northern boundary; No. 2 and 3 being eastward to the Ellis Island Ferry and United States Barge Office.
October 25, 1926.

P.L. Sperr.

716507f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - U.S.Custom House.
716507f-a.text:
Battery Park: A southeastward view, showing the State Street boundary, with the United States Custom House thereon.  Photographers vantage point is the Whitehall Building at West Street.
June 20, 1929.
P.L. Sperr
716507f-a.folder: Battery Park & U.S.Custom House., Manhattan, NY

716500f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park Fountain near Ellis Island Ferry House.
716500f-a.text:
Pigeons enjoying the Battery Park fountain, near the Ellis Island Ferry House, part of which is shown in the background.  The war memorial still has the wreath placed on it on Memorial Day.
June, 1929.
P.L. Sperr.
716500f-a.folder: Battery Park Fountain near Ellis Island Ferry House., Manhattan, NY

716488f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park Sea Wall.
716488f-a.text:
Battery Park: A northward view across same to Broadway, as seen from the Sea Wall.  Shown from right to left, and fronting on the confines of the Park, are, the Chesebrough, the Battery Park, the U.S. Custom House and the Washington Buildings.  O'ertowering same is the Standard Oil Building, at Bowling Green.
About 1928.
Ewing Galloway
716488f-a.folder: Battery Park Sea Wall., Manhattan, NY

716523f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium.
716523f-b.text:
Neg. B-21 & B-22
Battery Park - Aquarium
c. 1930
E.L. Armbruster - photographer

716523f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium.
716523f-a.text:
Neg. B-21 & B-22
Battery Park - Aquarium
c. 1930
E.L. Armbruster - photographer

716554f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street.
716554f-b.text:
(1)
Battery Park: A northwestward view across a corner of same, from State Street (trolley car thereon), and slightly southward of Pearl Street. Appearing across the elevated spur are the two units of the Whitehall Building; the Downtown Athletic Club; and framework of No. 21 West Street.
June 20, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a vantage point slightly westward.
June 20, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
716554f-b.folder: Battery Park & State Street., Manhattan, NY

716554f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street.
716554f-a.text:
(1)
Battery Park: A northwestward view across a corner of same, from State Street (trolley car thereon), and slightly southward of Pearl Street. Appearing across the elevated spur are the two units of the Whitehall Building; the Downtown Athletic Club; and framework of No. 21 West Street.
June 20, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a vantage point slightly westward.
June 20, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
716554f-a.folder: Battery Park & State Street., Manhattan, NY

716530f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716530f-a.text:
Battery Park, viewing northward towards Broadway, showing the building outline there.  Dominant, are the Standard Oil Building and the spired Bank of Manhattan.  The Irving Trust and Electric Bond & Share buildings are under construction.  At the right foreground is the U.S. Custom House.
July 1930
No's. 1-2.
George L. Belgue

716530f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716530f-b.text:
Battery Park, viewing northward towards Broadway, showing the building outline there.  Dominant, are the Standard Oil Building and the spired Bank of Manhattan.  The Irving Trust and Electric Bond & Share buildings are under construction.  At the right foreground is the U.S. Custom House.
July 1930
No's. 1-2.
George L. Belgue

716519f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium (rear).
716519f-a.text:
Battery Park: A northeastward view towards Broadway from the rear of the Aquarium.  Note the 60 Wall Street Building (Doherty Building) under construction.  No. 2 of this set is from a slightly advanced point of view, while No. 3 is further eastward.
June 18, 1931.
P.L. Sperr.

716519f-c.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium (rear).
716519f-c.text:
Battery Park: A northeastward view towards Broadway from the rear of the Aquarium.  Note the 60 Wall Street Building (Doherty Building) under construction.  No. 2 of this set is from a slightly advanced point of view, while No. 3 is further eastward.
June 18, 1931.
P.L. Sperr.

716519f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium (rear).
716519f-b.text:
Battery Park: A northeastward view towards Broadway from the rear of the Aquarium.  Note the 60 Wall Street Building (Doherty Building) under construction.  No. 2 of this set is from a slightly advanced point of view, while No. 3 is further eastward.
June 18, 1931.
P.L. Sperr.

716509f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Police Dock.
716509f-b.text:
(1)
Battery Park: The police dock well located at the foot of West Street, showing the "Ahto" docked therin.  This small sloop was sailed to this country by boys from Esthonia.
May 15, 1931
P.L. Sperr.

(2)
The United States Custom House at Bowling Green as viewed from the same point.
July 1, 1931
P.L. Sperr.
716509f-b.folder: Battery Park & Police Dock., Manhattan, NY

716509f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Police Dock.
716509f-a.text:
(1)
Battery Park: The police dock well located at the foot of West Street, showing the "Ahto" docked therin.  This small sloop was sailed to this country by boys from Esthonia.
May 15, 1931
P.L. Sperr.

(2)
The United States Custom House at Bowling Green as viewed from the same point.
July 1, 1931
P.L. Sperr.
716509f-a.folder: Battery Park & Police Dock., Manhattan, NY

716498f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park near South Ferry.
716498f-a.text:
Feeding the pigeons in Battery Park, near South Ferry: the view is north.
July 24, 1931.
P.L. Sperr.
716498f-a.folder: Battery Park near South Ferry., Manhattan, NY

716485f-c.title: Manhattan: Battery Park Sea Wall.
716485f-c.text:
Battery Park: Excursion boats tied up at the Sea Wall.  No. 1 shows the "Seagate" and the "Susquehanna"; No. 2 the "Bear Mountain" and No. 3, the "Wankets;" the latter going up Long Island Sound to Playland at Rye.
July 4, 1931.
P.L. Sperr.
716485f-c.folder: Battery Park Sea Wall., Manhattan, NY

716485f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park Sea Wall.
716485f-a.text:
Battery Park: Excursion boats tied up at the Sea Wall.  No. 1 shows the "Seagate" and the "Susquehanna"; No. 2 the "Bear Mountain" and No. 3, the "Wankets;" the latter going up Long Island Sound to Playland at Rye.
July 4, 1931.
P.L. Sperr.
716485f-a.folder: Battery Park Sea Wall., Manhattan, NY

716485f-b.folder: Battery Park Sea Wall., Manhattan, NY

716515f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium (rear).
716515f-b.text:
Battery Park: A set of 2 views northeastward towards Broadway from the rear of the Aquarium.
August 28 1932.
P.L. Sperr.

716515f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium (rear).
716515f-a.text:
Battery Park: A set of 2 views northeastward towards Broadway from the rear of the Aquarium.
August 28 1932.
P.L. Sperr.

716558f-c.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street (Northeast).
716558f-c.text:
Battery Park: A set of 3 views north and northeastward towards State Street from the Sea Wall and showing excursionists thronging same.
August 28, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
716558f-c.folder: Battery Park & State Street (Northeast)., Manhattan, NY

716558f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street (Northeast).
716558f-a.text:

August 28, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

P. L. Sperr.
716558f-b.folder: Battery Park & State Street (Northeast)., Manhattan, NY

716560f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street (Northeast).
716560f-b.text:
Battery Park: A set of 3 views northeastward towards State Street, showing citizens enjoying the Park facilities in the shadow of lower Manhattans skyscrapers.
August 28, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
716560f-b.folder: Battery Park & State Street (Northeast)., Manhattan, NY

716560f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street (Northeast).
716560f-a.text:

August 28, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
716560f-a.folder: Battery Park & State Street (Northeast)., Manhattan, NY

716560f-c.text:

August 28, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
716560f-c.folder: Battery Park & State Street (Northeast)., Manhattan, NY

716501f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park at Ellis Island Ferry House.
716501f-a.text:
Battery Park, at the Ellis Island Ferry House, view east.  The woman in the foreground is a fortune teller, for a nominal fee her parrot will pick you a printed card out of the box and on it you may read future weal or woe. You will probably be offered your choice of three or four different languages.
In the background is the South Ferry elevated station, where all four elevated lines have a united southern terminal.
August 28, 1932.
P.L. Sperr.
716501f-a.folder: Battery Park at Ellis Island Ferry House., Manhattan, NY

716564f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716564f-a.text:
Battery Park, a view northward to Broadway and showing the elevated lines curving from Battery Place (building line on the left) to State Street (line on the right).
November 23, 1932.
P.L. Sperr.

716561f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street (Northeast).
716561f-a.text:
Battery Park: A northeastward view towards State Street from the Sea Wall. Buildings shown lining this confine of the Park are: the United States Custom House, the Battery Park Building (No. 21-24 State Street) and the Chesebrough Building (No. 15-19 State Street). This set consists
of 2 views.
October 7, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
716561f-a.folder: Battery Park & State Street (Northeast)., Manhattan, NY

716561f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street (Northeast).
716561f-b.text:
Battery Park: A northeastward view towards State Street from the Sea Wall. Buildings shown lining this confine of the Park are: the United States Custom House, the Battery Park Building (No. 21-24 State Street) and the Chesebrough Building (No. 15-19 State Street). This set consists
of 2 views.
October 7, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
716561f-b.folder: Battery Park & State Street (Northeast)., Manhattan, NY

716536f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street (Northwest).
716536f-a.text:
Battery Park: The northwestern corner of same viewed in a westward direction from No. 24 State Street. Note the S.S. Washington about to put to sea.
September 27, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
716536f-a.folder: Battery Park & State Street (Northwest)., Manhattan, NY

716542f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street (Northeast).
716542f-b.text:
Battery Park: A set of 3 views in a northeastward direction towards State Street and showing there upon the low Custom House Building overshadowed by the towering Standard Oil, 60 Wall Street and the Farmers
Loan and Trust.Company Buildings.
Ju1y 11, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
716542f-b.folder: Battery Park & State Street (Northeast)., Manhattan, NY

716542f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street (Northeast).
716542f-a.text:
Battery Park: A set of 3 views in a northeastward direction towards State Street and showing there upon the low Custom House Building overshadowed by the towering Standard Oil, 60 Wall Street and the Farmers
Loan and Trust.Company Buildings.
Ju1y 11, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
716542f-a.folder: Battery Park & State Street (Northeast)., Manhattan, NY

716542f-c.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street (Northeast).
716542f-c.text:

Loan and Trust.Company Buildings.
Ju1y 11, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
716542f-c.folder: Battery Park & State Street (Northeast)., Manhattan, NY

716532f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716532f-a.text:
Battery Park: A panoramic set of 2 views northward across same from the waters edge and towards Broadway.
September 16, 1935.
P.L. Sperr.

716516f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium.
716516f-a.text:
Battery Park: A southward view of the Aquarium, located in the southwestern corner of same. This building, with its lengthy history is one of New Yorks major points of interest.  No. 2 of this set of 2 views shows a closer view.
June 25, 196.
P.L. Sperr.

716516f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium.
716516f-b.text:
Battery Park: A southward view of the Aquarium, located in the southwestern corner of same. This building, with its lengthy history is one of New Yorks major points of interest.  No. 2 of this set of 2 views shows a closer view.
June 25, 196.
P.L. Sperr.

716520f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium.
716520f-a.text:
Battery Park;  A set of three views westward across the southwestern corner of same, showing the Aquarium at the foot of the North (Hudson) River.  Across the latter appears the New Jersey shoreline.  In Nos. 2 and 3, we see the giant "Normandie" putting to sea.
september 16, 1936

F. L. Sperr.

716520f-c.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium.
716520f-c.text:
Battery Park;  A set of three views westward across the southwestern corner of same, showing the Aquarium at the foot of the North (Hudson) River.  Across the latter appears the New Jersey shoreline.  In Nos. 2 and 3, we see the giant "Normandie" putting to sea.
september 16, 1936

F. L. Sperr.

716520f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium.
716520f-b.text:
Battery Park;  A set of three views westward across the southwestern corner of same, showing the Aquarium at the foot of the North (Hudson) River.  Across the latter appears the New Jersey shoreline.  In Nos. 2 and 3, we see the giant "Normandie" putting to sea.
september 16, 1936

F. L. Sperr.

716510f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - The Firehouse.
716510f-a.text:
Battery Park: The firehouse at
the Battery that provides a base for the several fireboats serving the City. No records of its construction can be found and it probably dates from the same time as the Park, 1886. In the background of same appears the rear of the circular aquarium. This photo was reproduced on page 30 in the published volume "Changing New York."
May 12, 1936
Berenice Abbott, photo
Federal Art Project
716510f-a.folder: Battery Park & The Firehouse., Manhattan, NY

716494f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park new ticket booth.
716494f-a.text:
Battery Park: A northward view from the Sea Wall and in a line with Broadway (center). Note the new Ticket Booth. This set consists of three similar views.

August 30, 1936.
Views 2 & 3: August 16, 1936.

P.L. Sperr.
716494f-a.folder: Battery Park new ticket booth., Manhattan, NY

716495f-b.text:
Battery Park: A northward view from the Sea Wall and in a line with Broadway (center). On the left appears the new Ticket Booth.  This set consists of three more or less similar views.
August 16, 1936.
P.L. Sperr.
716495f-b.folder: Battery Park new ticket booth., Manhattan, NY

716508f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716508f-a.text:
Department of Docks and Police Station
Pier A, North River, Manhattan
Federal Art Project
"Changing New York"
Berenice Abbott, photographer
Neg. No. 97
[Note: negative at Museum of the City of New York]
Code II D-1
May 5, 1936
p. 18, Changing New York

716535f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716535f-b.text:
(1)
Battery Park: The northwestern corner of same, viewed in a westward direction from No. 17 State Street and showing across the North (Hudson) River the New Jersey shoreline.  The structure shown on the right is the Whitehall Building.
September 16, 1936.
P.L. Sperr.

(2)
A similar view and showing also the S.S. "Normandie" and the new Downtown Athletic Club.
September 16, 1936.
P.L. Sperr.

(3)
A portion of the view seen in No. 2 and emphasising the aforementioned structure.
September 16, 1936.
P.L. Sperr.

716535f-c.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716535f-c.text:
(1)
Battery Park: The northwestern corner of same, viewed in a westward direction from No. 17 State Street and showing across the North (Hudson) River the New Jersey shoreline.  The structure shown on the right is the Whitehall Building.
September 16, 1936.
P.L. Sperr.

(2)
A similar view and showing also the S.S. "Normandie" and the new Downtown Athletic Club.
September 16, 1936.
P.L. Sperr.

(3)
A portion of the view seen in No. 2 and emphasising the aforementioned structure.
September 16, 1936.
P.L. Sperr.

716535f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716535f-a.text:
(1)
Battery Park: The northwestern corner of same, viewed in a westward direction from No. 17 State Street and showing across the North (Hudson) River the New Jersey shoreline.  The structure shown on the right is the Whitehall Building.

A portion of the view seen in No. 2 and emphasising the aforementioned structure.
September 16, 1936.
P.L. Sperr.

716543f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - [View from confluence of North (Hudson) and East Rivers.]
716543f-a.text:
(1)
Battery Park; A northward view of same as seen from the confluence of the North (Hudson) and East Rivers. Surrounding and over-shadowing this garden area are office structures of downtown Manhattan's
business and financial district.
July 1, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, viewing eastward, showing the Fireboat Station and the
Aquarium.
July 19, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

716555f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Broadway (North).
716555f-a.text:
Battery Park: A set of three views of same in a westward direction from the waters edge. No. 1 shows the new ticket booth partially obstructing a view of the Aquarium. Prominent structure appearing is the Whitehall Building. No. 2 shows a comfort station. No. 3 is at the sea wall and showing a northward view up Broadway.
July 19, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

716538f-a.text:
(1 & 2)
Battery Park: A view northward from the Landing Platform and showing a troop of Boy Scouts en route from a Washington Jamboree. Note the Aquarium on the left, silhouetted against the Washington Building. View No. 2 is similar and includes a concessionaire booth.
July 10, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The ticket booth as viewed in an eastward direction towards State
Street.
July 10, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

716491f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park Sea Wall.
716491f-a.text:
(1)
Battery Park: A northward view of the western half showing the S.S. "Tourist" at the Sea Wall.  Buildings at the northern confine are on the north side of Battery Place from West Street (left) to Whitehall Street (right). Note the Aquarium on the extreme left.
July 10, 1937.
P.L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, slightly in towards shore.
July 4, 1937.
P.L. Sperr.

716550f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - [Shore and skyline.]
716550f-a.text:
Battery Park, its embarkadero and excursion steamers nestling at the tip of Manhattan and washed by the confluence of the Hudson and East Rivers. Thru the center is the Broadway canyon and its towering office buildings. Pyramiding to the right are the Wall Street structures, dominated by the lofty Bank of Manhattan and
the City Bank-Farmers Trust Co. Buildings.
1938-9
Alexander Alland
716550f-a.folder: Battery Park & [Shore and skyline.], Manhattan, NY

716513f.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium.
716513f.text:
Battery Park: The entrance to the Aquarium.
1938-9
Alexander Allard

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N.Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Allard, IRGV.

716483f.title: Manhattan: Battery Park waterfront
716483f.text:
The Battery Park waterfront with the moored tugboat "Pentucket." Across the bow of same appears a glimpse of Bertholdi's "Statue of Liberty" in the Upper Bay.
1939
Alexander Allard

716484f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park waterfront.
716484f-a.text:
The Battery Park waterfront and a departing excursion boat. The Statue of Liberty in the Upper Bay is reached from boats that leave from this point.
1939
Alexander Allard

716553f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716553f-a.text:
Battery Park: The Bulletin Board that was presented to the City by John D. Reilly, the head of the Todd Ship Yards. This is a constant source of interest to business men, employees, visitors and others, emphasising the importance of New York as a great sea port. In the background are the various structures forming the well known skyline. Prominent among these are the Irving Trust, the Standard Oil, and the Bank of Manhattan buildings.
The New York Herald-Tribune of November 12, 1939, Section VII
(gravure) carried a similar view.
July 28, 1939
P. L. Sperr

716528f.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716528f.text:
Battery Park: The Bowling Green-Broadway area as viewed from the rear of the Aquarium.  Outstanding there is the distinctive Standard Oil Company Building.  The inspiring Bank Of Manhattan Tower is just beyond.
1938-9
Alexander Alland

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N.Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.

716576f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Washington Street
716576f-a.text:
Battery Place, north side, east from Washington Street, showing mainly the street frontage extending to Greenwich Street where the old 6th E. 9th Avenue "El" station appears. The latter is shortly to be demolished.
April 6, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr
716576f-a.folder: Battery Park & Washington Street, Manhattan, NY

716576f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Washington Street
716576f-b.text:
Battery Place, north side, east from Washington Street, showing mainly the street frontage extending to Greenwich Street where the old 6th E. 9th Avenue "El" station appears. The latter is shortly to be demolished.

716576f-b.folder: Battery Park & Washington Street, Manhattan, NY

716524f.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - [Aquarium].
716524f.text:
Battery Park: The present Aquarium at the time when it was the Emigrant Landing Office "Castle Garden". It was erected in 1807 and known as "Castle Clinton".  Ceded to the City in 1822, it was leased as a place of amusement.  Various celebrities appeared here, including the world wide renowned Jenny Lind.  It was placed in the depicted service in 1855, continuing until the fire of May 23, 1870.  Rebuilt internally, it was used for concerts for several years.  The Park Commissioner had it altered to its present form.
Between 1855-70.

Gift of Urbrook Collection

716565f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - [Northward view to Broadway.]
716565f-b.text:
Battery Park: A northward view to Broadway, showing those magnificent stone piles that form the famous downtown outline. This set consists of 3 views from slightly different angles.
September 4, 1932.
View 2:-November 23, 1932.
View 3:-June 4, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

Battery Park. The "Ahto" (Walter).
Used in Digest, May 30, 1931.
"Al1 Shipshape After 11,000 Miles."
"The 'Ahto' and her crew arriving at the Battery, New York." International News Photos, Inc., 235E.45th St., N.Y.C.

716546f.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - [Shore and skyline.]

716514f-c.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Aquarium.
716514f-c.text:
Battery Park: A set of 4 views of the Aquarium, located in the southwestern corner of the Park at the waters edge.  This structure was completed in 1805 as Fort Clinton, subsequently known as Castle Garden during which period (1822-1855) numerous celebrities performed here.  In 1855 it became the State Immigrant Depot and nearly ten millions of immigrants passed through its walls.  In 1893, these duties being assured by the federal government, it was ?? for the new Depot on Ellis Island and became the present Aquarium in 1896 under the direction of the New York Zoological Society.
Aug 11, 1923
Views 2&3-October 1928
View 4-May 1929
Eugene L Armbruster Collection.

716539f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Battery sea wall ; New York Aquarium ; S.S. "Normandie".

716511f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Firehouse.
716511f-a.text:

June 11, 1920.
Views 2 & 3: -July 1, 1931

P. L. Sperr.

716504f-c.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - U.S. Barge Office.
716504f-c.text:
(1)

Battery Park: A view of the U.S. Barge Office, on the water's edge, at the southeastern corner of the Park. Partially shown, at the rear of the same, is the South Ferry Landing. These have been replaces, as shown in View No. 3.

About 1900

August Loeffler
P. L. Sperr Collection

(2)

A northward view of same, from the water. Note to the left of same, the old Washington Building and to the right, the Produce Exchange Building; all bearing flags. This point, the southernmost tip of Manhattan, is the confluence of the North (Hudson) and the East Rivers, forming what is known as the Upper Bay.

About 1905

(3)

A similar view of the locality seen in No. 1 and showing the new building that replaced the old Barge Office.

Summer 1924.

P. L. Sperr.
716504f-c.folder: Battery Park & U.S. Barge Office., Manhattan, NY

June 28, 1936.
View 2:-August 16, 1936.
View 3:-July 4, 1937.
P.L. Sperr.
716487f-c.folder: Battery Park Sea Wall., Manhattan, NY

716489f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park Sea Wall.
716489f-b.text:
(1&2)
Battery Park: A set of 2 views Northward to Broadway, with the towered Standard Oil Building theron, at Bowling Green.  Note the Sea Wall in the foreground.
September 20, 1936.
P.L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, from the deck of a steamer tied up to the Sea Wall.
July 1, 1937.
P.L. Sperr.

716490f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park Sea Wall.
716490f-b.text:
(1)
Battery Park: Individuals reclining on the grass near the Sea Wall, to which are tied the Steamers, "Belle Island" and "Bear Mountain".
July 1, 1931.
P.L. Sperr.

(2)
A stroller seeking an escape from the heat of the City.
About 1935.

716563f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716563f-a.text:
Battery Park: A northward view to Broadway from the waters edge. This thoroughfare is in the center where the spire of Trinity Church appears. To the left and right of same, respectively are, the Washington Building and the Produce Exchange. Note the uniform residences on the later Custom House site.
1890's
J.S. Johnston
Thru the New York Historical Society

716533f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716533f-b.text:
(1) and (2)
Battery Park: An eastward view towards State Street and showing same curving between Broadway (left) and Whitehall Street (right). Across the skyline appears the Standard Oil, the Bank of Manhattan an the City Bank-Farmers Trust Company (under construction) Buildings.  No. 2 of this set is in an northeastward direction, through the Broadway construction, over the Produce Exchange Building roof.  Note the west side elevated lines curving eastward towards South Ferry.
October 3, 1930.
View 2:-July 26, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.

(3)
A view similar to No. 1 from the steamer "Westchester". Note on the extreme left of the Irving Trust Building, same being No. 1 Wall Street.
July 1, 1937.

716525f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716525f-a.text:
Battery Park: A view limited to the present Aquarium and which at the time of the photograph was the Emigrant Landing office "Castle Garden". Erected in 1807 as Castle Clinton it was ceded to the city in 1822 and leased as a place of amusement.  In May 1855 it was placed in the depicted use, continuing the same until the fire of May 23, 1870.  Rebuilt internally it was used for concerts for a short time.  The Park Commissioner then altered it for its present purpose.
Between 1855 & 70
Gift of Urbrook Collection

716531f-c.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716531f-c.text:
Battery Park: A northward view towards its building outline at Battery Place, extending from West Street on the left to Broadway on the right.  View No. 1 shows the outstanding structures identified as the Whitehall, the Washington, the Bowling Green, the U.S. Customs House, the Battery Park and the Chesebrough buildings.  View No. 21 includes the annex to the Whitehall Building and the West Street building.  Note the Singer Tower at the right.  At the right margin of View No. 3 is the Standard Oil Building.  The Downtown Athletic Club and an adjoining structure appear in No. 4.

1: 1905
2: 1911
3: 1929, august
4: 1930, July

George L. Balgue, photo

716527f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716527f-a.text:
Battery Park: The Salt Water Floating Bath photographed from the Aquarium, "Castle Garden".  The view is westward across the North (Hudson) River towards the New Jersey Shore.
About 1870.
Urbrock Collection
Neg #427

716534f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716534f-b.text:
Battery Park and its surrounding office structures as viewed northward from the waters edge.  Broadway is thru the center where the dominant Standard Oil Building appears.  This overlooks the Washington, Custom House and Cheseborough buildings.  In the background are the Irving Trust, Equitable Trust, Bank of Manhattan and the City Bank Farmers Trust buildings.  Note the old Elevated Line winding its way around the park to enter Greenwich Street.

October 1928
August 1929
February 1931

George L. Balgue

716562f-c.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716562f-c.text:
Battery Park: A northwestward view towards Battery Place and West Street and showing upon the latter the two units of the Whitehall Building; the Downtown Athletic Club, and the United Fruit Building. This is a set of 3 views; No. 3 being photographed from the South Ferry Terminal of the Elevated Lines. Buildings appearing on the right of
the latter are on State Street.
July 23, 1932.
View 2:-October 3, 1933.
View 3:-May 25, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

716566f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716566f-b.text:
(1)
Battery Park: A view northeastward across the northern edge of same, towards the foot of Broadway and showing upon the latter the Standard Oil Tower under construction. Note the changed appearance of the Washington
Building, which appears in the center.
Summer 1923.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date.
June 1925.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A more inclusive view.
September 31, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.
